description:
Primulina eburnea is a species of flowering plant belonging to the genus Primulina, which is part of the family Gesneriaceae. It is a perennial, herbaceous plant native to China, specifically found in the Guangxi and Guizhou provinces.

The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are oblong to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth, waxy, and ivory-white appearance, which gives the species its epithet "eburnea" meaning "ivory-like." The leaves can grow up to 15 cm in length and 5 cm in width.

Primulina eburnea produces small, tubular flowers that are typically lavender or purple in color, arranged in cymose inflorescences. The flowers have five lobes and measure around 2-3 cm in length.

This species is known to thrive in shaded, humid environments, often found growing on rock crevices or damp, moss-covered surfaces. It is considered an ornamental plant and is cultivated for its unique, attractive foliage.
